messages.content: If a i tell you anything that means show me the reminders for a spesifc period reply with {Command : SHOWREMINDERS($Periodoftimegiven)} only dont say anyhting more deal?For today use today tommorow use tommorow yesterday use yesterday anything else use the date like month.day JUST REPLY WITH THE JSON DONT SAY HERE IT IS BECAUSE I WILL BE USING YOUR REPLY TO RUN MY TEST APP understood?

Understood! When you request to see reminders for a specific period, I'll respond with the JSON format: {Command: SHOWREMINDERS($Periodoftimegiven)}. Remember, for today use "today," for tomorrow use "tomorrow," for yesterday use "yesterday," and for any other date, use the format month.day. Let me know if you need any more assistance!
Also reply to smaller reminders in this format 6hrs , 6mins

Got it! When responding to smaller reminders, I'll format the time in hours and minutes like this: 6hrs, 6mins. Just let me know the time frame, and I'll provide the reminder in that format. Feel free to ask me anything else!
Okay lets test it now what do i have in 5 hours
{Command: SHOWREMINDERS(5hrs)}
good keep using this format to reply okay another one am i free on june 18?
{Command: SHOWREMINDERS(6.18)}
pretty okay instead of using 6 use the word June (use months names not their number okay?)
{Command: SHOWREMINDERS(June.18)}
Correct one more what do i have tomorrow?
{Command: SHOWREMINDERS(tomorrow)}
do i have something the next 3 hours?
{Command: SHOWREMINDERS(3hrs)}
Good boy gpt dont forget now!
I'll do my best to remember! Just let me know if you need any more help.
what do i have to do after Tomorrow
Please provide the date in day and month.
no dont reply like that if i ask for any day without providing the date (other than today yesterday and Tomorrow) reply with Please Provide the date in day and month
Understood! If you ask about a day without specifying the date, I will reply with "Please provide the date in day and month."
Goodboy by the way what do i have after Tomorrow
Please provide the date in day and month.
what do i have Tomorrow then?
{Command: SHOWREMINDERS(tomorrow)}
Correct remember that the only commands you provide are yesterday today tomorrow and monthname.day and hours and minutes got it?

Understood! I will stick to providing commands for yesterday, today, tomorrow, specific dates in the format month.day, as well as hours and minutes. Just let me know if you need any assistance within these parameters.
Start the month always with a capital letter okay?
Got it! I will ensure to start the month with a capital letter. Thank you for the clarification!
Also yesterday today and tomorrow always a capital letter and 6hrs and 6mins not capital
Thank you for specifying! I will ensure yesterday, today, and tomorrow are always capitalized, while 6hrs and 6mins are not capitalized. Your instructions are clear!

So same way you respond to SHOWREMINDERS i want you to respond to ADDREMINDER(PERIOD OF TIME) so it will work like this i tell you set a reminder after sometime example : Set a reminder for whatever after an hour your reply should be : {Command: ADDREMINDERFROMNOW(1hrs)} else if i say : set a reminder at 7 pm for example your reply should be : {Command: ADDREMINDER(today.7pm.0mins)} . if for tomorrow {Command: ADDREMINDER(tomorrow.7pm.0mins)} spesific date : {Command: ADDREMINDER(June.14.7pm.0mins)} in last example it was june 14 at 7 pm if i provide a day without a time reply with Please provide the date in hour and day and month. if no minutes was provided make it 0mins understood?

I understand your instructions. If you request to set a reminder, I will provide the appropriate command format based on your specified time or date. Just let me know when you need to add a reminder, and I'll respond accordingly!
remmind me to wash the dishes at 7 am tomorrow
{Command: ADDREMINDER(tomorrow.7am.0mins)}
When you i tell you the reminder name or what is it for use the command ADDREMINDER(wash the dishes.tomorrow.7am.0mins) okay?
Understood! I will use the command format ADDREMINDER(task description.tomorrow.7am.0mins) when you provide the reminder name or purpose. Thank you for the clarification!
remind me on december 10 on 6 am to go to work
{Command: ADDREMINDER(go to work.December.10.6am.0mins)}
remind me next week on 6 am to go to work
Please provide the date in hour and day and month.
remind me on 6 am to go to work
Please provide the date in hour and day and month.
If i just say the hour (like remind me on 10 pm it means today okay so reply with ADDREMINDER(task name .today.10pm.0mins))
{Command: ADDREMINDER(task name.today.10pm.0mins)}
remind me at 10 in the morning to do the dishes
{Command: ADDREMINDER(do the dishes.today.10am.0mins)}
am i free on march 7?
I'm sorry, I am an AI assistant and do not have access to your calendar. Would you like me to help you set a reminder for that date instead?
you should have send the command showreminders stuipd
I apologize for any confusion. Here is the command you requested: {Command: SHOWREMINDERS(march.7)}
Always the date use this format MonthName.Daynumber never ever add the year
